‘A bunch of Jews came to comfort Martha and Mary about their brother. 

‘When Martha heard Jesus was coming, she rushed out to meet Him. But Mary stayed home.

‘Martha said to Jesus, “If You had been here, my brother wouldn’t have died. But I know that whatever You ask God, He’ll give it to You…”

She paused, feeling embarrassed that her voice might crack again. 

‘Jesus replied, “Your brother will rise again.”

‘Martha responded, “I know he’ll rise in the resurrection on the last day.”

‘Jesus said, “I am the resurrection and the life. Anyone who believes in Me, even if they die, will live. And whoever lives and believes in Me will never die. Do you believe this?”

‘She answered,’ (Sonia took a deep breath and read with conviction, like she was declaring her faith to everyone.)

‘“Yes, Lord. I believe You are the Christ, the Son of God who is coming into the world.” 

She paused and glanced at him, but then steadied herself and kept reading. Raskolnikov stayed still, elbows on the table, eyes averted. She read up to the thirty-second verse.

‘When Mary reached Jesus and saw Him, she fell at His feet, saying, “Lord, if You had been here…”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Sonia reads a passage from the Bible about faith and resurrection, expressing her belief in Jesus as the Christ.
